item.title: Alena Powell
item.description: As someone who is mixed and has a passion for understanding human behavior in sociological and health contexts, my TED talk highlights a cultural and sociological phenomenon, the individualist vs.

item.title: Alex Lippe
item.description: Hi my name is Alex, I joined Avenues in 2018 as a freshmen. Since I’ve become a member of the Avenues community I have been focused on how to strengthen student voices and create outlets for students to share their stories and passions.

item.title: Alexander Farman-Farmaian
item.description: My talk is about the negative affects the American media has had on people living in Iran. The United States’ foreign policy with Iran had been mostly amicable until the hostage crisis in 1979.

item.title: Daniel Chuang
item.description: Hi, I’m Daniel. I’ve been watching TED talks for years now, through classes, with family members, or just by myself. I especially enjoy watching the TED riddles, such as the bridge problem.

item.title: David Allyn
item.description: “The Power of Thinking Like a Historian”

item.title: Jonathan Waldorf
item.description: At TEDx Avenues, I’m going to talk about how we can save lives through science and technology. Last summer I was lucky enough to work in a lab where researchers were tracking tornadoes using infrasound, which is below the range of human hearing.

item.title: Joseph Weissberg
item.description: Joseph Weissberg is a senior at Avenues. His interest in behavioral economics was, in fact, sparked by watching TED talks by Dan Ariely. He interned at Kayma, a behavioral economics consulting firm located in Israel, and has deeply immersed himself within the field.

item.title: Robert L
item.description: Hey! I’m Robert. As a Senior in highschool, the most important lesson I’ve learned is the value of helping others. I’m always looking to support the people around me, because their smiles matter more than any achievements I could possibly hold.
